u: An indigenous tribe of the Amazon forest.

a: An indigenous tribe of central Brazil.
The South American palm tree Attalea maripa (syn. Maximiliana maripa, formerly also Maximiliana regia).

u: A Brazilian cryptolect spoken by adherents of African-Brazilian religions and by the Brazilian LGBT community.

g: (historical) An ethnic group of the Guaycuru peoples in the Northern Chaco of Paraguay.

a: Any of several similar South American bromeliad plants, Bromelia serra, Bromelia pinguin or Bromelia balansae (syn. Bromelia argentina), which yield a long, silky fiber used for making cords, sacks, etc.
(music) An accordion-based style of music from Cape Verde.

n: A Brazilian cylindrical rattle used as a percussion instrument, especially in samba music.
A dish from Andalusia, consisting of meat that has been slowly cooked for a long time until it falls apart easily.

a: An Afro-Brazilian dish made with bread, shrimp, coconut milk, peanuts and palm oil mashed into a creamy paste.
